definition: to whom the deer falls (idiom); the one to emerge victor (i.e. to seize the empire)/prize winner/champion
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: Watch June 13th on CBS to see who wins.
sentences.chinese: 請關注六月十三日的CBS看鹿死誰手。

sentences.english: Yet with a week to go before polling day, it is anybody's guess who will win.
sentences.chinese: 距離投票日還有一週時間，每個人都在猜測鹿死誰手。

sentences.english: Tonight's semifinals match is too close to call.
sentences.chinese: 今晚半決賽中究竟鹿死誰手還難以知曉。

sentences.english: Trilingual deer skin is rare, the outcome will become a hero.
sentences.chinese: 皮肉俱佳的鹿實在難得，鹿死誰手誰就成了英雄。

definition: to be a cinch/in the bag/(of a person) confident of success
each sticks to his own version (idiom); a dialogue of the deaf
lit. the river that divides Chu and Han/fig. a line that divides rival territories/the mid-line between sides on a Chinese chessboard
to enroll in the Communist Youth League
the critical moment/life and death crisis
the trick of injuring oneself to gain the enemy's confidence/CL:條|条[tiao2]
clever and eloquent (idiom); fluent/having the gift of the gab
man behind the mirror/puppet master/string puller
